alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 09 at 9:07AM CST until March 10 at 1:42PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Tombigbee River at Bigbee For the Tombigbee River...including Fulton, Bigbee, Amory, Aberdeen L & D...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River at Bigbee. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Flooding of low-lying agricltural land is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 12.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 15.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
